message.content: This question tests knowledge about the nervous system and how it responds to stimuli. When a person blows on another person's arm, the nerves in that area will detect the stimulus and send signals to the brain, alerting it of the sensation. Option (A) is incorrect because the nerves do not curl up and die in response to blowing on someone's arm. Option (B) is not related to the function of nerves in this context. Option (C) is incorrect because the nerves in the area do not make more nerves in response to blowing on the arm.

This question requires basic knowledge about the nervous system. When a person blows on another person's arm, the nerves in that area will send signals to the brain, alerting it to the sensation of the blowing. Option (A) is incorrect because blowing on the arm does not cause nerves to "curl up and die." Option (B) is incorrect because the nerves do not signal to the sky, but rather to the brain. Option (C) is incorrect because blowing on the arm does not cause more nerves to be made in that area.

Option (C) is incorrect because blowing on the arm does not cause the formation of more nerves in that area.
